org.jasig.cas.ticket.registry

Class MemCacheTicketRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jasig.cas.ticket.registry.AbstractTicketRegistry
      • org.jasig.cas.ticket.registry.AbstractDistributedTicketRegistry
        • org.jasig.cas.ticket.registry.MemCacheTicketRegistry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TicketRegistryState, TicketRegistry, org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean

    public final class MemCacheTicketRegistry
extends AbstractDistributedTicketRegistry
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.DisposableBean
    Key-value ticket registry implementation that stores tickets in memcached keyed on the ticket ID.
    Since:
    3.3
    Author:
    Scott Battaglia, Marvin S. Addison

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.jasig.cas.ticket.registry.AbstractTicketRegistry

    • Constructor Detail

      • MemCacheTicketRegistry

        public MemCacheTicketRegistry(String[] hostnames,
                      int ticketGrantingTicketTimeOut,
                      int serviceTicketTimeOut)
        Creates a new instance that stores tickets in the given memcached hosts.
        Parameters:
        hostnames - Array of memcached hosts where each element is of the form host:port.
        ticketGrantingTicketTimeOut - TGT timeout in seconds.
        serviceTicketTimeOut - ST timeout in seconds.

      • MemCacheTicketRegistry

        @Deprecated
public MemCacheTicketRegistry(long ticketGrantingTicketTimeOut,
                                 long serviceTicketTimeOut,
                                 String[] hostnames)
        Deprecated. This has been deprecated
        This alternative constructor takes time in milliseconds. It has the timeout parameters in order to create a unique method signature.
        Parameters:
        ticketGrantingTicketTimeOut - TGT timeout in milliseconds.
        serviceTicketTimeOut - ST timeout in milliseconds.
        hostnames - Array of memcached hosts where each element is of the form host:port.
        See Also:
        MemCacheTicketRegistry(String[], int, int)

      • MemCacheTicketRegistry

        public MemCacheTicketRegistry(net.spy.memcached.MemcachedClientIF client,
                      int ticketGrantingTicketTimeOut,
                      int serviceTicketTimeOut)
        Creates a new instance using the given memcached client instance, which is presumably configured via net.spy.memcached.spring.MemcachedClientFactoryBean.
        Parameters:
        client - Memcached client.
        ticketGrantingTicketTimeOut - TGT timeout in seconds.
        serviceTicketTimeOut - ST timeout in seconds.

      • addTicket

        public void addTicket(Ticket ticket)
        Description copied from interface: TicketRegistry
        Add a ticket to the registry. Ticket storage is based on the ticket id.
        Specified by:
        addTicket in interface TicketRegistry
        Parameters:
        ticket - The ticket we wish to add to the cache.

      • deleteTicket

        public boolean deleteTicket(String ticketId)
        Remove a specific ticket from the registry. If ticket to delete is TGT then related service tickets are removed as well.
        Specified by:
        deleteTicket in interface TicketRegistry
        Parameters:
        ticketId - The id of the ticket to delete.
        Returns:
        true if the ticket was removed and false if the ticket did not exist.

      • getTicket

        public Ticket getTicket(String ticketId)
        Description copied from interface: TicketRegistry
        Retrieve a ticket from the registry.
        Specified by:
        getTicket in interface TicketRegistry
        Parameters:
        ticketId - the id of the ticket we wish to retrieve
        Returns:
        the requested ticket.

      • getTickets

        public Collection<Ticket> getTickets()
        Retrieve all tickets from the registry. This operation is not supported.
        Specified by:
        getTickets in interface TicketRegistry
        Returns:
        collection of tickets currently stored in the registry. Tickets might or might not be valid i.e. expired.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if you try and call this operation.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
             throws Exception
        Destroy the client and shut down.
        Specified by:

      • setSynchronizeUpdatesToRegistry

        @Deprecated
public void setSynchronizeUpdatesToRegistry(boolean sync)
        Deprecated. As of version 3.5, this operation has no effect since async writes can cause registry consistency issues.
        Parameters:
        sync - set to true, if updates to registry are to be synchronized

      • needsCallback

        protected boolean needsCallback()
        Description copied from class: AbstractDistributedTicketRegistry
        Whether or not a callback to the TGT is required when checking for expiration.
        Specified by:
        needsCallback in class AbstractDistributedTicketRegistry
        Returns:
        true, if successful
